programme.subtitle: The Executive's Executioner
programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Norm's boss makes him an offer he can't refuse: accept a promotion or lose his job. So Norm finds himself in charge of firing other employees. (S3 Ep21/25)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.subtitle: Cheerio, Cheers
programme.desc: Diane decides to leave the bar and travel to Europe with Frasier. She wishes Sam would stop her from going, but he's too busy organising her farewell party. (S3 Ep22/25)

programme.title: The King of Queens
The King of Queens
programme.subtitle: Pilot
programme.desc: US comedy about Doug, a New York postman who is king of his castle. Life is good with his loving wife Carrie and prized new TV, but then his recently widowed father-in law moves in.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.subtitle: Robert's Rodeo
programme.desc: When Robert is injured in the line of duty, Ray realises that he is partly, although unwittingly, responsible.
When Debra discovers that Ray taped over their wedding video with the Super Bowl, he has to go to extreme lengths to make it up to her.
programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.subtitle: The Tenth Anniversary

programme.title: Frasier
programme.subtitle: Sweet Dreams
programme.desc: Frasier puts his job on the line by refusing to read out an advertisement on air for the radio station's new sponsor.
Frasier's unemployment situation brings about various emotional responses, including denial, anger and depression.
programme.title: Frasier

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Charlie's Italian Bistro in La Verne, southern California, where the decor is more authentically Italian than the soggy pasta on the menu.

programme.desc: In Sheffield, student Dylan - who lacks glassware and cutlery, and uses the top of his bin as a makeshift bar - takes on party girl Lynsey, confident Jamie and fashion designer Charlotte.

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
